guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.

drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a
few storm drain on Clover Heights.

The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.

There are two
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would
require a vehicle impact protection device.

The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop
a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations.

Agenda Item # 4.A. Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

bridge.

Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing the existing storm
drain on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH
that was damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop
a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations.

The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged
guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule: TBD

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project design will commence during the Spring 2022.

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Completion Date: Spring 2022

There are two
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would

The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.
